sentence.Network_en: He was surprised they had married — they had seemed so different.
sentence.Network_cn: 他俩居然结婚了——这让他非常惊讶，因为他们实在是太不一样了。

sentence.Network_en: The duke was surprised by his wife's omission from the guest list.
sentence.Network_cn: 公爵对他的夫人未在获邀宾客之列感到意外。

sentence.Network_en: My voice surprised me; it was even and emotionless.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的声音听起来心平气和、不露一丝感情，这让我自己颇感惊讶。

entry.tran: 惊奇的;惊讶的;觉得奇怪的;感觉意外的
entry.def: If you are surprised at something, you have a feeling of surprise, because it is unexpected or unusual.

example.ex: This lady was genuinely surprised at what happened to her pet...
example.tran: 这位女士对发生在自己宠物身上的事感到非常惊讶。

example.ex: Chang seemed surprised to find the big living-room empty...
example.tran: 张看到偌大的客厅里空无一人，似乎很惊讶。

means.word_mean: 1. taken unawares or suddenly and feeling wonder or astonishment;

auth_sentence.content: We shouldn't be surprised that no-one is perfect.
auth_sentence.res_content: We shouldn't be surprised that no-one is perfect.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We shouldn't be surprised that no-one is perfect.

auth_sentence.content: We were pleasantly surprised when we looked into this.
auth_sentence.res_content: We were pleasantly surprised when we looked into this.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We were pleasantly surprised when we looked into this.

auth_sentence.content: No politician will be surprised by any of that.
auth_sentence.res_content: No politician will be surprised by any of that.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No politician will be surprised by any of that.

Sentence.sentence: I'm surprised that was still in business.
You would not be surprised if a stranger tried to shake hands when you were introduced, but you might be a little startled if they bowed, started to stroke you or kissed you on both cheeks.
Grace Kao, a professor at Penn said she was not surprised by the findings.
This attitude would have surprised the ancient Greeks,who believed humor to be essentially aggressive.
So she was not surprised to see a number of hands go up as soon as she finished speaking
tour operator Explore has been surprised to see an increase in last-minute bookings of high-priced trips to such places as India, Bhutan and Nepal.

means.word_mean: 感到惊奇的;表示震惊的

sentences.en: When Tom gave him the money, the beggar was surprised and seemed grateful.
sentences.cn: 当汤姆给他钱时, 乞丐很惊奇而且好像很感激。

sentences.en: Are you surprised to see Einstein on a Chinese stamp?
sentences.cn: 看到中国邮票上的爱因斯坦你感到惊奇吗?

sentences.en: I’m surprised that you should think this way.
sentences.cn: 我感到奇怪的是你竟这样想。

sentences.en: I was surprised why he came here so early.
sentences.cn: 他为什么那么早到这里, 我很惊奇。

sentences.en: I wouldn’t be surprised if he changed his mind.
sentences.cn: 如果他改变主意, 我不会感到惊讶。

sentences.en: I was very much surprised at the news.
sentences.cn: 听到那消息我非常诧异。

sentences.en: I was surprised at hearing him say so.
sentences.cn: 我听到他这样说很吃惊。
